parameters: I'll patch the data in to the main computer as well.
Scanning area and comparing with computer records.
\C[0]Records corroborated. The Wolf 359 Memorial Station is
orbiting Wolf 359, a Class M red dwarf star.
Information on Wolf 359 has been added to our library computer.
\p[1], welcome to the Wolf 359 Memorial Station.
The Wolf 359 Memorial Station serves both as a memorial to the
lives lost in the Battle of Wolf 359 as well as a museum honoring
Feel free to let your crew visit the Ossuary to view the starships
Hood and Columbia, or take a walk down the Cenotaph and learn more
about the floating starship hulks left behind from the battle.
You can find more information throughout our facilities. Details of
every starship involved in the battle can be found along the
Cenotaph, and more is available in the museum and visitors' center.
You can find more information about the greater Wolf 359 Project;
"We Have Engaged the Borg - The Oral History of The Battle of Wolf
Incoming message from the station, Captain.
\p[1], what the hell are you doing?
Captain, we're reading a small squadron of ships on an intercept
Escort \v[7] out of the system at once!
It has been converted into a museum ship.
In my opinion, \v[17], we should not interfere with the Hood.
However, the crew will follow your orders.
We're beaming over a crew to salvage it now, \v[17].
Reputation Name = United Federation of Planets
We've beamed a crew over to the \n[74] and the ship
is now fully operational and a part of our task force.
